column5: I have already booked my vacation to go steelheading based on weather forecasts which have been rarely accurate ... what a waste to my vacation!  The weather forecast said it was going to rain 15~20mm on Tuesday so I quicky booked Friday off to find some steelies ... guess what ... It says it will not rain until Saturday ... Needless to say, I cancelled my vacation and am now hestitated to book Monday off ..
If you wait till all the lights are green to go to town, you'll never leave the house.  Hope you have a good day whichever you pick.

It did rain in some places, and still is in Niagara. Forecast is a general prediction, not a site specific estimate of weather activity.  Years back there was this invisible weather line through Hammy Harbour. Blue skies  from burlington to Oshawa, and snow from Hamilton down.  The weather man kept predicting blue skies. He wasn't wrong and he wasn't quite right.
When I want to go fishing and it starts to rain, I just put on a rainsuit and go anyways  But your right about the forecasts, I never put much faith in them either.
